analyzed: aṅghri jaṅghā tathā dhāraḥ kaṇṭhaḥ ca evā ūrddha paṭṭike

Bestowing peace and nourishment, blessed, granting all accomplishments,

analyzed: eṣā candrakalā matā  ṣaṣ bhāga bhājite kṣetre jaṅghā paṭṭikā
translated: This is the lunar digit, considered fallen from the imperial nectar.🔽In a field divided into six parts, the shank, the pot, the half-pendant,

translated: The neck, the sub-neck, the pendant, should be the pedestal of Hari.

analyzed: yakṣau turaga bhājitau
translated: In a height divided into eight parts, the Yaksha and the horse are divided.

analyzed: p
pādam ārabhya grīvā antam ekaikam hrāsayet padam
translated: Starting from the foot up to the neck, one should reduce each step by one part.

original: grīvā dvābhyāntathā jaṅghā praveśo muni saṃkhyayā /

translated: Granting all accomplishments, auspicious, beneficial to all, always worshipped by all,

analyzed: nandāvarta aṅkitā bhadrā nandāvartā iti viśrutā

analyzed: iti piṇḍī samākhyātā vakṣye brahmaśilām tava

analyzed: ekaika aṅgulam anyeṣām hrāsayet kramatas hare

analyzed: ca anyeṣām hrāsayet kramatas punar

analyzed: iti brahmaśilā ca eva praṇālam adhunā ucyate

analyzed: sadā śreṣṭhaḥ sva tri bhāga ambu nirgamaḥ

analyzed: sampannaḥ praṇālam sukha daḥ yatas

analyzed: liṅge dṛśyam bhūta yavam bhavet

analyzed: ca anyeṣām hrāsayet kramatas tatas

analyzed: samāsena samuddiṣṭam pīṭham brahmaśilā ādikam
translated: The pedestal, Brahma stone, etc. have been briefly indicated.

analyzed: sura dhāmāni kathyante bhū parīkṣā ādi pūrvakam

with the paths of white lotuses and swans, with clear waves,

analyzed: vāstu aṅge devatānām ca saṃkhyā hi eṣā purandara

translated: The trident should be of two and a half angulas in the best, of four and a half in the medium,

original: rasa candraiḥ kaniṣṭheḥ syāt triśūlaṃ surasattama /
analyzed: rasa candraiḥ syāt triśūlam sura sattama
translated: and of three and a half in the smallest, O best of gods.

original: sa tāragolakatyāgādadhodaḥ syād dvayandvayam //🔽koṇāsre tuṣṭi tuṣṭyaṃśe madhyaśūlaṃ grahāṃśakaiḥ /
analyzed: sa tāra golaka tyāgāt adhas daḥ syāt  koṇa asre tuṣṭi tuṣṭi aṃśe madhya śūlam graha aṃśakaiḥ
translated: By omitting the ball of the star, the two should be below.🔽In the angular trident, the middle trident should be with the parts of the planets, in the part of satisfaction and satisfaction.

analyzed: yakṣa aṃśa vistṛtiḥ madhye tīkṣṇa agra manupātataḥ
translated: The width in the middle should be with the parts of Yaksha, with a sharp tip according to the proportion.

analyzed: mūle bhāga pravistīrṇam yat vā śobhā anurūpataḥ
translated: At the base, it should be as wide as the parts, or according to the beauty.

analyzed: rasa aṃśaiḥ sūtra bhramaṇāt
translated: It should be one part wide and long, by revolving the thread with the parts of rasa.

analyzed: madhye hastam vyavasthāpya vṛtta ākāram su śobhanam
translated: Having placed the hand in the middle, it should be very beautiful in the form of a circle.

original: vahirmadhye karandhṛtvā madhye saptāṃśasaṃsthitam //🔽bhrāmayed dakṣa hastena pārśvayoḥ śūlasiddhaye /
analyzed: vahis madhye karan dhṛtvā madhye sapta aṃśa saṃsthitam  bhrāmayet dakṣa hastena pārśvayoḥ śūla siddhaye
translated: Having held the hand in the middle outside, it should be situated in the middle with seven parts.🔽It should be revolved with the right hand on the sides for the accomplishment of the trident.

original: adho rekhā dvayaṃ kāryamarddhacandro pumaṃ hare //
analyzed: adhas rekhā dvayam kāryam hare
translated: Two lines should be made below, in the shape of a half-moon, O Hari.

analyzed: sūtreṇa vistṛtiḥ bhāga saṃmitā
translated: The width should be equal to the number of parts by a thread one and a half times the length of a fortnight.

original: śṛṅgayorvāhya rekhinyau vāhyavṛttena vinyaset //🔽p / 🔽mdhyasthe caiva rekhe dve madhya vṛttena yojayet /
analyzed: śṛṅgayoḥ vāhya rekhinyau vāhya vṛttena vinyaset  p  ca eva rekhe dve madhya vṛttena yojayet
translated: The outer lines of the peaks should be placed along the outer circle.🔽The two middle lines should be connected with the middle circle.

original: adhobhāga dvayaṃ kiñcid vibhāgāntarasaṃsthitam //🔽arddhacandravidhānena bhrāmayet syād yathā gatiḥ /
analyzed: adhobhāga dvayam kiñcid vibhāga antara saṃsthitam
translated: The two lower parts should be placed a little inside the divisions.🔽It should be rotated in the shape of a half-moon so that it moves.

analyzed: gaṇḍikā bhūṣitam mūle kuśanturya asra kantu adhas
translated: The base should be adorned with a Gandhika, and below it should be a triangular Kusha.

analyzed: śeṣa rekhā vināśena triśūlam parikīrtitam
translated: The remaining lines should be destroyed, and the trident is proclaimed.

analyzed: vinyaset kalaśa upari
translated: On the sides, above the pot, one should place the thread of the Dhama.

original: agre pṛṣṭhe ca yat sūtraṃ madhyaśūlena saṅgatam /
analyzed: agre pṛṣṭhe ca yat sūtram madhyaśūlena saṅgatam
translated: The thread in front and behind, connected with the middle spike,

original: jagatī vandhakaṃ vakṣe dikṣu devālayaiḥ saha //🔽prāsādārddhena sā kāryā pādonā vātha tatsamā /
analyzed: jagatī vandhakam vakṣe dikṣu devālayaiḥ saha  prāsāda arddhena sā kāryā pāda ūnā vā atha tad samā
translated: I will describe the Jagati Bandha along with the temples in the directions.🔽It should be made half the size of the palace, or a foot less, or equal to it.

original: maṇḍapāgre ca tat tulyā caturasrā suśobhanā //
analyzed: maṇḍapa agre ca tat tulyā catur asrā su śobhanā
translated: In front of the pavilion, it should be equal, well-adorned with a square.

analyzed: prāsāda arddhena tad vāhye dikṣu aṣṭau devatāḥ laye
translated: Outside it, half the size of the palace, in the directions, there should be eight temples for the deities.

analyzed: tad arddham vāhyataḥ tyaktā bhittiḥ vandham tu kārayet
translated: Outside that, half of it should be left, and the wall should be made as the Bandha.

analyzed: prāsāda bhitti vat kāryan jagatyāḥ bhitti vandhanam  prāsāda sama saṃsthāna ākhura ādi bhūṣaṇa anvitā
translated: The jagati should be constructed like the wall of a palace, serving as a binding wall.🔽Having the shape of a palace, adorned with ornaments like the hoof,

original: ūrddhvaṃ varaṇḍikā yuktā yathā vā tuṣṭi mā vahet /
analyzed: ūrddhvam varaṇḍikā yuktā yathā vā tuṣṭi mā vahet
translated: Equipped with an upper balcony, as much as may please.

original: ajaṃ nandīṃ mahākālaṃ prāci vā vajrapāṇinam //
analyzed: ajam nandīm mahākālam prāci vā vajrapāṇinam
translated: The unborn, Nandi, Mahākāla, or Vajrapāṇi in the east,

analyzed: arddhanārīśvaram sūryam āgneyyām vā hutāśanam
translated: Ardha-nārīśvara, Sūrya, or Hutāśana in the southeast,

analyzed: mātṛ cakram gaṇeśam vā kṛtāntam dakṣiṇe sthitam
translated: The circle of mothers, Gaṇeśa, or Yama should be placed in the south,

analyzed: aśvinau snāyu bhṛṅgī sannaddham  nyaset
translated: The two Aśvins, Sāyana, and Bhṛṅgīsanāt, should be placed in the southwest.

analyzed: mṛtyughnam yoginam devam vāruṇe
translated: The god Mṛtyuñjaya, the yogi, should be placed in the west, and Varuṇa in the northwest.

analyzed: ṣaṇmukham viśvakarmāṇam vāyavyā meṇagam nyaset
translated: The six-faced Viśvakarman should be placed in the northeast, along with the serpent.

analyzed: kuberam lokapaiḥ yuktam saumye devīm umām nyaset
translated: Kubera, along with the Lokapālas, and the goddess Umā should be placed in the north.

analyzed: cakriṇam caṇḍa nāmānam īśānam vā sva gocare
translated: The discus-holder named Caṇḍa, or Īśāna, should be placed in its own sphere.

analyzed: prāsāda abhimukhāḥ sarve madhya sūtra vivarjitāḥ
translated: All of them should face the palace, avoiding the central thread.

analyzed: maṭhaḥ ca antaka digbhāge liṅginām sthitaye hitaḥ  p
translated: The monastery is beneficial for the residence of the Liṅgins in the southwest.

analyzed: yatas te dakṣiṇa sāyām vaseyuḥ śiva bhāvitāḥ
translated: For they should dwell there in the south, purified by Śiva.

analyzed: prāsāda vistaram vahis
translated: The thread should be extended to the extent of the palace. That measure is the circumference outside.

original: prākāraṅkārayet tyaktā tataścāśramiṇāṅgṛham //🔽maṭhāgre tatsamantyaktā siṃhoyaṃ dakṣiṇe sthitam /
analyzed: prākāram kārayet tyaktā tatas ca āśramiṇām gṛham  maṭha agre tat samantyaktā siṃhoyam dakṣiṇe sthitam
translated: The wall should be constructed, leaving space for the hermit's house.

original: vṛṣoya paścime jñeyaṃ dhvajeyaṃ pūrvataḥ sthitam //
analyzed: paścime jñeyam dhvajeyam pūrvatas sthitam
translated: The lion is to be placed on the right side of the monastery, the bull is to be known as being on the west, and the flag is to be placed on the east.

analyzed: vipulam vā prakartavyam kartuḥ icchā vasena tu
translated: Or it can be made extensive, according to the wish of the performer.

analyzed: catur asre śaraiḥ bhakte madhyantī aktāḥ vilopayet
translated: In the square, divided by arrows, leaving out the middle, one should remove.

original: gṛhāṇāṃ svecchayā nyāsaḥ saumye syād vaśanirgamaḥ /
analyzed: gṛhāṇām sva icchayā nyāsaḥ saumye syāt vaśa nirgamaḥ
translated: The assignment of houses is according to one's own wish. The exit should be in the north.

original: ekabhaumaṃ dvibhaumaṃ vā tribhaumaṃ vā yathāsukham //
analyzed: ekabhaumam dvibhaumam vā tribhaumam vā yathāsukham
translated: One can have one, two or three stories as one pleases.

analyzed: dīrghaśālā vṛtam vāhye prāciyāga ālaya anvitam
translated: Outside, there should be a long hall, along with a sacrificial house facing east.

analyzed: pāka ādi gṛha vinyāsam yathāyogam niveśayet
translated: The arrangement of the kitchen and other houses should be done as appropriate.

analyzed: pūrva uktam antaram ca arddha antasya api arddham yathāyatham
translated: The space mentioned earlier, half of that, and half of that respectively,

original: maṭhikaikā trayaṅkāryaṃ paṭṭaśālā catuṣkikā //🔽bhūmayaḥ pūrvamuddiṣṭhā vittābhāve kuṭī matā /
analyzed: maṭhikā ekā trayaṅkāryam paṭṭaśālā catuṣkikā  bhūmayaḥ vitta abhāve kuṭī matā
translated: one small room should be made, and a quadrangle for the cloth.🔽The stories have been mentioned earlier. In the absence of wealth, a small hut is considered.

analyzed: sama sūtram su saṃsthānam vāstu pūjā puraḥsaram
translated: The site should be well-arranged with equal threads, preceded by the worship of the site.

analyzed: liṅginām ca gṛham kāryam mahā puṇya jigīṣayā
translated: And the house of the Liṅgins should be made with a desire for great merit.

original: etadeva mahāpuṇyaṅkathayāmi tavākhilam //🔽saṃsthāpya sthāvaraṃ liṅgamprāsāde yad bhavet phalam /
analyzed: etat eva mahā puṇyam kathayāmi tava akhilam  saṃsthāpya sthāvaram liṅgam prāsāde yat bhavet phalam
translated: I shall tell you this alone, which is of great merit.

original: tatphalaṃ labhate vidvān maṭhe saṃsthāpya jaṅgamam //
analyzed: tat phalam labhate vidvān maṭhe saṃsthāpya jaṅgamam
translated: The learned one obtains the same fruit by installing the movable Liṅga in a monastery as he would get by installing the immovable Liṅga in a temple.

analyzed: purā ādau nūtana ārambhe purātane
translated: In a new construction of a city or temple, or in the renovation of an old one,

analyzed: ādau saṃpūjayet vāstum kha viyat indu bhājite
translated: one should first worship the Vastu deity, divided into the parts of the sky, earth, and moon.

analyzed: carakya ādyāḥ śarāva sthāḥ skanda ādyāḥ veda saṅga tāḥ
translated: The Charakas and others are in the position of the potsherds, Skanda and others are associated with the Vedas,

analyzed: diti īśau antarikṣa arci eṇa pitṛ rūjā anilaḥ
translated: Diti, Ishana, Antarikṣa, Arci, Eṇa, Pitṛ, Rūja, and Vāyu,

analyzed: pada arddha arddha bhujaḥ śeṣāḥ pada avasthāḥ purandara
translated: The remaining ones, Purandara, are in the position of the feet, half-feet, and half-feet.

analyzed: tadvat ā pādapaḥ tu aṣṭau marīca ādyāḥ rasa adhipāḥ  p
translated: Similarly, the eight Marīci and others are the lords of the Rasas.

analyzed: svayambhūḥ veda saṃsthaḥ tu pūjā homa ādi pūrvavat
translated: The self-existent one is in the Vedas. The worship, oblations, etc. are as before.

analyzed: ādi liṅgaiḥ guṇān jñātvā bhruvaḥ yatra guṇa utkaṭam
translated: Having known the qualities from the primordial Liṅgas, where the quality is prominent between the eyebrows,

analyzed: sthānam bhūbhṛt nivāsāya
translated: The place is of three kinds, depending on the Bhūtas, for the residence of the mountain.

analyzed: viyat rasa grahaiḥ ekam viyat nāga yama indubhiḥ
translated: One is by the Rasas of the sky, the other by the sky, Nāga, Yama, and the moon.

original: khaviyadrasarūpaistu tṛtīyaṃ kṣetra lakṣaṇam /🔽caturasraṃ smṛtaṃ kṣetraṃ rājñāmāyatanasya tu //
analyzed: kha viyat rasa rūpaiḥ tu tṛtīyam kṣetra lakṣaṇam  catur asram smṛtam kṣetram rājñām āyatanasya tu
translated: The third field is characterized by the sky, the moving, the liquid, and the solid.🔽The field is considered to be quadrangular, for the abode of the king.

original: durgādau sanniveśe tu pādabhāgāya taṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: durga ādau sanniveśe tu pāda bhāgāya tam smṛtam
translated: In the layout of a fortress, etc., it is remembered as a quarter part.

analyzed: kanyasam madhyaman jyeṣṭha nṛpāḥ vāsam vibhūtitaḥ
translated: The king's residence is small, medium, or large, according to his affluence.

analyzed: sādhayitvā purā tatra sūtra antāra ādi sādhanaiḥ
translated: Having accomplished the mantra and the sādhana there in the past,

analyzed: diś vidikṣu jñātvā vai mandirāpatim
translated: having made it equal in all directions, having known the lord of the house,

analyzed: prāsāda vat yajet vāstum śilāni āsantu kārayet
translated: one should worship the Vastu like a palace, and have the stone foundation laid.

original: pīṭhocchritiṃ tridhā jñātvā jyeṣṭhamadhya kanīyasīm //🔽brahmasthāne gṛhaṅkuryānnāgadikkaramānakam /
analyzed: pīṭha ucchritim tridhā jñātvā kanīyasīm  brahmasthāne gṛhaṅkuryāt nāga dikkara mānakam
translated: Having known the height of the pedestal to be threefold - the best, the medium, and the small,🔽one should build the house in the place of Brahman, measuring it from the direction of the serpent.

analyzed: bhūta yugmaiḥ tatas vāhye prākāram parikalpayet
translated: Then, outside, one should conceive the rampart with pairs of beings.

analyzed: diśābhiḥ ca antar antyaktā kha viyat tanubbiḥ gṛham
translated: The house is abandoned in the intermediate directions, in the sky, the moving, the liquid, and the solid.

original: dakṣiṇe yamarānnastanedanāgairjaleśagam //🔽uttaraṃ rasa gotraistu pāda saṃvarddhitāni tu /
analyzed: dakṣiṇe yamara anna staneda nāgaiḥ jaleśa gam  uttaram rasa gotraiḥ tu pāda saṃvarddhitāni tu
translated: In the south, Yama is worshipped, in the west, Varuṇa, in the north, Kubera.🔽The quarters are increased by half, starting from the east.

analyzed: pṛthak prākāra guptāni śeṣāṇi arddha arddhataḥ bhajet
translated: The other quarters are protected by separate ramparts, each half the size of the previous.

original: dhvajaṃ dhūmaṃ tathā siṃhaṃ śvāvṛṣokhara kuñjarau /🔽dhvāṃkṣañcaiva yathā nyāyaṃ pūrvādāvāyasaṃsthitiḥ //
analyzed: dhvajam dhūmam tathā siṃham śvāvṛṣa ukhara kuñjarau  dhvāṃkṣan ca eva yathā nyāyam pūrva ādau āya saṃsthitiḥ
translated: The flag, smoke, lion, dog, bull, donkey, elephant,🔽and crow, in the proper order, are located in the east and other directions.

analyzed: pūrvavat antar antyaktā vedāsram kārayet vahis
translated: The altar should be made outside, divided into nine parts like before, with the inner parts omitted.

original: mūla gṛhasya pādena navadhā bhājayet punaḥ //
analyzed: mūla gṛhasya pādena navadhā bhājayet punaḥ
translated: Again, the base of the main house should be divided into nine parts.

original: īśādau kathyate nyāsaḥ saṃkṣiptante prarandara /🔽śānti cihnālayandharmastvakāndhāna vastrakam //
analyzed: īśa ādau kathyate nyāsaḥ saṃkṣipta ante prarandara  vastrakam
translated: The placement is described starting from the northeast, O Parāśara.

analyzed: p
translated: The abode of peace, the abode of Dharma, the abode of the blind, the abode of the cloth,🔽the abode of the twins,

analyzed: yugme pākam ca pātrāṇām bhojana artha upayoginām
translated: the abode of the cooks and the vessels used for eating,

analyzed: vitathe mantriṇām sthāna mantra mārga upadeśinām
translated: the abode of the ministers who instruct in the ways of policy,

original: śastramantaḥ puraṅgāt kastūrī sauca veśma ca /🔽tāṃ mūlaṃ saṅgrahaḥ strīṇāṃ pācakānstrī niyāmakān //
analyzed: śastram antar puraṅgāt kastūrī sauca veśma ca  tām mūlam saṅgrahaḥ strīṇām pācakān strī niyāmakān
translated: the abode of weapons, the inner quarters, the abode of musk and cleanliness,🔽the abode of the chief, the abode of women, the cooks who prepare food for women,

analyzed: bhojyam senāpatiḥ mantrī vaidya gandha upajīvinām
translated: the abode of food, the general, the minister, the physician, and those who live on perfumes,

original: maṇipuṣpādi saṃsthānaṃ mukhye dūta gṛhantataḥ //🔽rājahastyādi saṃsthānaṃ kṣīrārthaṃ kāṣṭhikaṅgṛham /
analyzed: maṇi puṣpa ādi saṃsthānam mukhye dūta gṛhantataḥ  rāja hasti ādi saṃsthānam kṣīra artham
translated: the abode of the chief messenger, situated in the main direction,🔽the abode of the king's elephants, etc., the abode of carpenters for dairy purposes,

analyzed: utsāra kālayam ca ante iti evam
translated: and the abode of the sweeper at the end - thus is the king's house.

analyzed: mahā rāja adhirājasya jñeyam etat śacīpate
translated: O Lord of Shachi, this should be known by the great king of kings.

original: vihāya vāhyage hāni sthitirmadhya yathā grahaiḥ //
analyzed: vihāya vāhya ge hāni sthitiḥ madhya yathā grahaiḥ
translated: Abandoning external gains, stability is like the planets in the middle.

analyzed: sāmānyasya nṛpasya evam kanyasasya viparyayaiḥ
translated: Thus for an ordinary king, and for a low king, with the opposite.

analyzed: nyūnam vā api adhikam kāryam jñātvā bhūti valāvalam
translated: Having known the deficiency or excess, one should act for one's own prosperity and strength.

original: hastyaśvādi kṛte śeṣaṃ subhṛtyānāṃ yathā sukham /
analyzed: hasti aśva ādi kṛte śeṣam su bhṛtyānām yathā sukham
translated: For the sake of elephants, horses, etc., the remaining should be used for the well-being of good servants.

original: prākāraṃ kārayed vāhye śikhāhālādi bhūṣitam //🔽pratolī turya saṃyuktaṃ vedāmrādyaiḥ sumaṇḍapaiḥ /
analyzed: prākāram kārayet vāhye śikhā hālā ādi bhūṣitam  pratolī turya saṃyuktam vedāmra ādyaiḥ su maṇḍapaiḥ
translated: One should get a rampart built outside, adorned with turrets, watchtowers, etc.🔽The street should be equipped with four turrets, and with beautiful pavilions made of gold, mango trees, etc.

analyzed: aṣṭha hasta ucchritam kāryam pṛthu tvam su dṛḍham yathā
translated: It should be seven cubits high, and as wide as possible, and very strong.

analyzed: vahis vahi sthitānām tu madhyasthānām ruciḥ yathā
translated: As desired by those living outside and in the middle,

original: yākṣaṃ jalādhipaṃśākraṃ tridvāraṃ vāhayet sadā //🔽dakṣadvāraṃ sadāpihitaṃ saṅgrāmeṇa vinā hare /
analyzed: yākṣam jalādhipam śākram tri dvāram vāhayet sadā  dakṣa dvāram sadā apihitam saṅgrāmeṇa vinā hare
translated: one should always have the three doors of the palace facing the Yakshas, the Lord of Waters, and Shakra (Indra).🔽The southern door should always be closed, except in battle, O Hari.

analyzed: vahis khāti kapāyuktantat vahis śastribhiḥ bhaṭaiḥ
translated: Outside, it should be filled with archers, and outside that with soldiers armed with weapons.

analyzed: sapta prākāra yuktam vā mahā rāja adhi mandiram
translated: The palace of the great king of kings should have seven ramparts.

original: dvāre dvāre niyoktavyāḥ kāṣṭhikāḥ śaskiṇo bhaṭāḥ //
analyzed: dvāre dvāre niyoktavyāḥ kāṣṭhikāḥ śaskiṇaḥ bhaṭāḥ
translated: At each door, carpenters and armed soldiers should be appointed.

original: dṛḍhaṃ parīkṣitaṃ dvāraṃ vāhyato viśataḥ kramāt /
analyzed: dṛḍham parīkṣitam dvāram vāhyataḥ viśataḥ kramāt
translated: The door should be firmly tested, and one entering from outside should do so in order.

analyzed: antarvāsaḥ na kasya asti yāvat nā vedayet nṛpaḥ  p
translated: No one should stay inside as long as the king has not been informed.

analyzed: rājñatva viditāḥ tatra na viśanti kadācana
translated: The king should know those who are allowed to enter there and never enter without permission.

original: evaṃ nityanuraktasya kalyāṇaṃ nṛpateḥ sadā //🔽dvāre dvāre caturdikṣu haṭṭaḥ kāryaḥ suśobhanaḥ /
analyzed: evam nitya anuraktasya kalyāṇam nṛpateḥ sadā  dvāre dvāre catur dikṣu haṭṭaḥ kāryaḥ su śobhanaḥ
translated: Thus, for a king who is always devoted, there is always welfare.🔽In each direction, a very beautiful market should be made at every door.

original: pūrva haṭṭasya madhye tu āyataḥ saumyayāmyayoḥ //
analyzed: pūrva haṭṭasya madhye tu āyataḥ saumya yāmyayoḥ
translated: In the middle of the eastern market, facing north and south,

analyzed: nagarī niṣkāśa paryantam haṭṭa mārgaḥ su śobhanaḥ
translated: the market road is very beautiful up to the outskirts of the city.

original: evaṃ dakṣe tathā varuṇe saumye mārga catuṣṭayam //
analyzed: evam dakṣe tathā varuṇe saumye mārga catuṣṭayam
translated: Similarly, in the south, west, and north, there are four roads.

analyzed: mahāpātaka saṃyuktāḥ ye ca anye pāpa karmiṇaḥ
translated: If Sandhya

analyzed: patitāḥ ca abhi śaptāḥ ca te tu varjyāḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: And those who have fallen and been cursed should be carefully avoided.

analyzed: ajñānāt saṅgatim kṛtvā dakṣiṇasyāḥ yutan japet
translated: If one has unknowingly associated with them, one should recite the Dakshina Yuta.

analyzed: na laṅghayet guroḥ chāyām na śivasya na liṅginām

analyzed: triśatam rūpiṇā japtvā go kanyā sa dvije śatam
translated: Having recited the Trishatarupi, one should recite the Goka and Kanya Shata for a Brahmin.

analyzed: sahasrāt luṭhite liṅge vartite dviguṇāt śuciḥ

analyzed: gaḍḍūka ādi abhighāte ca

original: stutyādau śleṣma saṃsparśe dakṣiṇasyā yuta trayāt /🔽iṣṭaliṅge hṛtenaṣṭe vahnilīḍhe pramādataḥ //

original: avisarjita pātre tu bhaṅge vātha vivartite /
analyzed: a visarjita pātre tu bhaṅge vā atha vivartite
translated: If the vessel is not released, broken, or turned over,

analyzed: śata dvayāt sahasra ante tad arddhāt kramatas śuciḥ

analyzed: dviguṇam sthaṇḍile prāhuḥ prāyaścittam makha adhipa

analyzed: nirvāṇe sa śive vahnau tri rātra samupoṣitaḥ  p

analyzed: ayutam rūpiṇām japtvā śuddhim icchantya saṃśayaḥ
translated: Reciting ten thousand times the mantra of the embodied form, they desire purity without doubt.

analyzed: rakṣite api hi nirvāṇe ahorātram upoṣitaḥ
translated: Even if the fire is protected and extinguished, fasting for a day and night,

analyzed: sahasram vahu rūpeṇa japtvā śuddhi ati sādhakaḥ  pūrvāhṇam ca eva madhyāhnam samāpya sthitaye tanau
translated: the practitioner becomes pure by reciting the mantra of the multi-formed one a thousand times.

analyzed: caret mādhukarīm bhikṣām bhukti mukti samīhakaḥ
translated: Having completed the morning and midday rites, one who desires enjoyment and liberation should go for alms.

original: bhikṣāṃ yācayitvā tu kiñcit sthitvānyato vrajet //
analyzed: bhikṣām yācayitvā tu kiñcid sthitvā anyatas vrajet

analyzed: a nivartitam bhramet bhikṣām jñātvā vṛttam ca varṇinām
translated: Knowing the conduct of the ascetics, one should wander for alms without returning.

original: sthitiṃ buddhāśramaṅgacchecchuci sthāne nidhāya ca //🔽mṛdbhiḥ saṃśodhya caraṇau karau kṣālyā camettataḥ /
analyzed: sthitim buddha āśramam gacchet śuci sthāne nidhāya ca  mṛdbhiḥ saṃśodhya caraṇau karau kṣālya ā camet tatas
translated: One should go to a pure place, the abode of the Buddha, and place the alms there.🔽Having washed the feet and hands with clay, one should then sip water.

analyzed: bhasmasnāna antatas kṛtvā kṛt smaran
translated: Then, having performed the ash bath, remembering the mantra body,

original: astraṃ dīptoktayā plāvya prokṣyatāṃ trirvibhajya ca /
analyzed: astram dīpta uktayā plāvya prokṣyatām tris vibhajya ca

analyzed: śivāya guruve da tvā bhuñjīta vidhi pūrvakam
translated: Having given to the auspicious preceptor, one should eat in accordance with the rules.

original: ācāntaḥ pūrvavat snātaḥ smṛtvānatvā śivaṃ gurūm /
analyzed: ācāntaḥ pūrvavat snātaḥ smṛtvā a natvā śivam gurūm
translated: Having sipped water as before, having bathed, having remembered and saluted Shiva and the preceptor,

analyzed: a yācitaiḥ sthitim kuryāt sva dhanaiḥ vā krama āgataiḥ
translated: One should maintain oneself with things not begged for, or with one's own wealth obtained in due course.

analyzed: sva jāti dīkṣitaiḥ spṛṣṭaḥ snātvā camya śatañjapet
translated: Having touched one initiated in one's own caste, one should bathe, sip water, and repeat the mantra one hundred times.

original: tasmin na dīkṣite spṛṣṭe snātvā camya śatadvayam //
analyzed: tasmin na dīkṣite spṛṣṭe snātvā camya śata dvayam
translated: If one touches one not initiated in that, one should bathe, sip water, and repeat the mantra two hundred times.

original: samīpa dīkṣite spṛṣṭe snātvā camya śatadvayam /
analyzed: samīpa dīkṣite spṛṣṭe snātvā camya śata dvayam
translated: If one touches one initiated nearby, one should bathe, sip water, and repeat the mantra two hundred times.

analyzed: tasmin na dīkṣite spṛṣṭe sa upa vāsaḥ japaḥ mataḥ

analyzed: evam buddhvā prakartavyam itaraiḥ pāda varjitam
translated: Knowing this, it should be done in this way, with a quarter less by others.

original: puruṣāghora vāmājā jātīśā brāhmaṇāditaḥ //🔽trirātramantyaja sparśādaṃ ghorasyā yutācchuciḥ /

translated: The Aghora, Vama, and Jati lords of the male, female, and neuter genders, beginning with Brahmins,🔽Become pure after three nights from touching an outcaste, according to the Aghora.

original: sa kṛcchraṃ tryayutaṃ śakracaṇḍāla sparśane diśet //
analyzed: sa kṛcchram tri ayutam śakracaṇḍāla sparśane diśet
translated: If one touches a Chandala, one should perform a Krichchhra for thirty thousand times, O Shakra.

original: jñātvā nyatra prakartavyaṃ prāyaścittaṃ surādhipa /🔽annāghraṃ madirā spṛṣṭaṃ yadi bhuṅktetva kāmataḥ //
analyzed: jñātvā nyatra prakartavyam prāyaścittam surādhipa  annāghram madirā spṛṣṭam yadi kāmataḥ
translated: Knowing this, the expiation should be performed elsewhere, O Lord of the gods.🔽If one knowingly eats food touched by wine,

original: viṇmūtra retasā duṣṭaṃ līḍhaṃ vā kākakukkuraiḥ /🔽p /
analyzed: retasā duṣṭam līḍham vā kāka kukkuraiḥ 🔽p
translated: Or defiled by feces, urine, or semen, licked by crows or dogs,

analyzed: kapi grāha śivā dakṣaiḥ viḍvarāhaiḥ ca dūṣitam
translated: Contaminated by monkeys, crocodiles, jackals, crows, and pigs,

analyzed: śūdrāt ucchiṣṭa saṃpṛktam pṛṣṭam vā jātibhiḥ
translated: Or by food remnants of Shudras, or eaten by dogs of different castes,

analyzed: kṛtvā snānat nirāhāraḥ pañcagavyam samācaret
translated: Having bathed, fasting, one should perform the Panchagavya rite.

analyzed: pratisandhyam japet aghoram samāhitaḥ
translated: At each junction, one should concentratedly chant the Aghora mantra one thousand times.

analyzed: syāt tris snāyī dhyāna tatparaḥ
translated: For three days, one should eat only at night, bathe three times, and be devoted to meditation.

analyzed: devam iṣṭvā caturthehni sahasram homayet tatas
translated: Having worshipped the deity on the fourth day, one should then perform one thousand oblations.

analyzed: upavāsaḥ tathā naktam pañcagavyam viśuddhaye
translated: Fasting and eating only at night, Panchagavya is prescribed for purification.

original: kṣatriye dhyāna niṣṭhe tu śuddhimevaṃ vinirdiśet /
analyzed: kṣatriye dhyāna niṣṭhe tu śuddhim evam vinirdiśet
translated: For a Kshatriya devoted to meditation, purification should be prescribed thus:

analyzed: tri kālāt plavanam vaiśya sakṛt śūdre vinirdiśet
translated: For a Vaishya, bathing three times a day, and for a Shudra, bathing once a day is prescribed.

analyzed: akāmāt dviguṇam kāmāt sarveṣām parikīrtitam
translated: For all, it is declared to be double if done unintentionally, and four times if done intentionally.

analyzed: gṛñjana alāvu laśunam palāṇḍu kavakāni ca
translated: Garlic, onion, leeks, garlic chives,

original: ameddhyodbhavamāṃsaṃ bhuktā syān nirasanastryaham /🔽matsyakaṇṭaka sāmvūka nakhañcaiva kapardikā //
analyzed: ameddhyā udbhava māṃsam bhuktā syāt nirasanaḥ tri aham  matsyakaṇṭaka sāmvūka nakhañca eva kapardikā
translated: Having eaten meat from impure animals, one should fast for three days.🔽Fish, porcupine, iguana, and tortoise,

analyzed: pītvā nava udakam mantrī pañcagavyā upa vāsakam
translated: Having drunk fresh water, the mantra practitioner should perform Panchagavya and fast.

original: kṛmikīṭābhisaṃpṛktaṃ bhuktā kāntena śuddhyati //🔽makṣikā kīṭakeśaistu duṣṭaṃ tyaktālpa modanam /
analyzed: kṛmi kīṭa abhisaṃpṛktam bhuktā kāntena śuddhi ati  makṣikā kīṭa keśaiḥ tu duṣṭam
translated: If food mixed with worms and insects is eaten by the beloved, she becomes pure.🔽If rice is spoiled by flies, insects, and hair, a little should be discarded.

original: bhasma saṃspṛśya saṃprokṣya śeṣaṃ bhojyanna duṣyati //🔽pītaśeṣantu yattoyaṃ pramādādyadi tat pivet /
analyzed: bhasma saṃspṛśya saṃprokṣya śeṣam bhojyan na duṣyati  pīta śeṣam tu yat toyam pramādāt yadi tat pivet
translated: Touching and sprinkling with ash, the remaining food is not defiled.🔽If one drinks water left over after being drunk by mistake,

analyzed: upoṣya rajanīm ekām pañcagavyena śuddhi ati
translated: one becomes pure by fasting for one night and consuming the five products of the cow.

analyzed: pivantaḥ iyam patat panne tat annam yonti mohitaḥ
translated: If one drinks water that has fallen on the ground, or eats food out of delusion,

analyzed: sahasram rūpiṇī japtvā pañcagavyena śuddhi ati
translated: having muttered the Rupi mantra one thousand times, one becomes pure by consuming the five products of the cow.

analyzed: bhuñjānasya guda srāve ucchiṣṭasya indriya śurte
translated: If there is a discharge from the anus while eating, or if there is a discharge from the senses of one who is impure,

analyzed: ādau śaucam tatas snānam ācāntaḥ punar ācamet
translated: first one should purify oneself, then bathe, and having sipped water, sip water again.

original: sahasraṃ rūpiṇā japtvā sopa vāso viśuddhyati /🔽p / 🔽anācāntaḥ pivet toyaṃ bhakṣayed vātha mūtrayet //
analyzed: sahasram rūpiṇā japtvā saḥ upa vāsaḥ viśuddhi ati  p  an ācāntaḥ pivet toyam bhakṣayet vā atha mūtrayet
translated: Having muttered the Rupi mantra one thousand times, one becomes pure by fasting.🔽If one drinks water or urinates without having sipped water,

analyzed: a japtvā aghoram vinā āhāraḥ pañcagavyena śuddhi ati
translated: without having muttered the Aghora mantra, one becomes pure by consuming the five products of the cow.

analyzed: adha ucchiṣṭaḥ yadā mantrī viṣṭā madya ādi na āhataḥ
translated: If a mantra-reciting person is defiled by urine, feces, etc. while impure,

original: snātvo poṣya japed ghoraṃ pañcagavyena śuddhyati /
analyzed: snātvā u poṣya japet ghoram pañcagavyena śuddhi ati
translated: having bathed and fasted, one should mutter the Aghora mantra. One becomes pure by consuming the five products of the cow.

original: vinā yajñopavītena pivati bhuṅkte yadā naraḥ //
analyzed: vinā yajñopavītena pivati bhuṅkte yadā naraḥ
translated: If a man drinks or eats without the sacred thread,

analyzed: pañcagavya nirāhāraḥ japtvā ghoram viśuddhi ati
translated: Having fasted and muttered the terrible (mantra), he becomes pure by (drinking) the five products of the cow.

analyzed: ucchiṣṭaḥ tu yadā spṛṣṭaḥ ucchiṣṭaiḥ veṇukā ādibhiḥ
translated: If he is touched by leavings or by bamboo and other (impure things),

analyzed: snānam śauca nirāhāraḥ pañcagavya japāt śuciḥ
translated: Having bathed, being pure, fasting, and having muttered the five products of the cow, he becomes pure.

analyzed: ghoṣa arka rukma raupyāṇām vaṅga sīsakayoḥ api
translated: Of conch shells, cowries, oysters, gold, copper, silver, lead, and tin,

original: bhasmāmlavāriṇā śuddhirnirlayaṃ syād yadā hare /🔽śaṅkhaśāmvūka śuktīnāṃ tejasavacchuddhiriṣyate //
analyzed: bhasma amla vāriṇā śuddhiḥ nirlayam syāt yadā hare  śaṅkha śāmvūka śuktīnām tejasa vat śuddhiḥ iṣyate
translated: O Hari, when they are defiled by ashes, sour substances, or water, they become pure by being heated.🔽Of conch shells, cowries, and oysters, it is considered that they become pure by being heated.

analyzed: kvathitam kṣīram dadhi śuddhiḥ nigadyate
translated: Milk becomes pure by boiling; the purification of curd is declared (to be as follows):

original: dadhipātrāntare dhṛtvā vīkṣayet tadanantaram //🔽annādi lepanirmuktaṃ prokṣaṇācchuddhyate dadhi /
analyzed: dadhi pātra antare dhṛtvā vīkṣayet tad anantaram  anna ādi lepa nirmuktam prokṣaṇāt śuddhyate dadhi
translated: Having placed it in a vessel of curd, one should look at it afterwards.🔽Curd becomes pure by sprinkling, being freed from stains of food, etc.

analyzed: su taptasya śrutasya atha śuddhi rājyasya kīrti tā
translated: The purification of ghee that has been melted is declared (to be as follows):
